news.title: Facebook Templates for Business Posts About COVID-19 Changes
news.description: Business users can now take advantage of templates that will allow them to communicate information to their customers such as how to place orders despite a temporary closure.

news.title: Twitter Notifies Users That It’s Now Sharing More Data With Advertisers
news.description: Twitter has removed most users’ ability to opt out of sharing information with advertisers related to things like ads they’ve seen or interacted with, and their device’s tracking identifier.

news.title: YouTube Viewership Is Up, But YouTubers Are Earning Less Money
news.description: YouTube traffic has increased by 15% since the COVID-19 outbreak began, but content creators are making less money due to an almost 50% drop in YouTube advertising rates.

news.title: Facebook Ads Fails to Reject COVID-19 Misinformation
news.description: Facebook’s AI-driven ad screening process failed to identify several fake ads containing false coronavirus information created to test the reliability of the platform’s ad filtering system.
